bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: David Clark was born in 1937 to a working-class family in Bristol where he won a scholarship to a grammar school and later to Cambridge. National Service in the RAF interrupted his schooling and included the Russian course at Crail in 1956 which proved providential many years later. After earning University degrees in classics and theology, Clark prepared for his calling in both scholarship and missions as a Bible translator.

In 1965-66, Clark, his wife, and young daughter lived in the bush with the Ekpeye people group in the Niger delta analyzing the language and helping create a writing system in preparation for Bible translation. His publication Babes in the Jungle: A Year of Life in the Niger Delta (Fontes, 2019) shares that experience which was foundational in writing his doctoral dissertation on the Ekpeye language at the London School of Oriental and African Studies.

Dr. Clark eventually became a translation consultant with the United Bible Societies and along with his family, spent 20 years in Thailand (two assignments), Papua New Guinea, and India. In 1991, the Clarks moved back to England to work in the European region, specifically in several former Soviet republics with a focus on minority Russian languages, including Yakut, Khakas, Tuvan, Kalmyk, and Chechen. He also served in shorter assignments with projects in Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Belarus, Moldova, Ukraine, Azerbaijan, and Kyrgyzstan, some of which were initiated by UBS’ partner organization, the Institute for Bible Translation in Moscow. Clark retired in 2002 but continued part-time until 2009.

Materials in the collection include reports of Clark’s field trips and working sessions that illustrate how Bible translation flourished between 1992 and 2014, particularly in Russia, as well as related items, including photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The David Clark materials cover the period from 1992 to 2014 with the bulk from 1994 to 2002. The collection focuses on issues of Bible translation projects.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Keston Center received David Clark’s materials that contain reports of his working sessions and field trips that illustrate how Bible translation flourished between 1992 and 2014. Photographs of those involved in the translations are also included.
The David Clark Papers are organized in three series: I. Correspondence, II. Europe Field Trips, and III. Languages.

did.unittitle: Chechen (Meetings with the Chechen team regarding Genesis, Acts, John, Daniel, I Thessalonians, 2 Thessalonians, 1 & 2 Timothy, Titus, James, 2 Peter and Jude, Ephesians, Philippians, Colossians, and 1-3 John, Judges, Esther, and Ecclesiastes, Joshua and Revelation, Romans, Luke, 1 & 2 Corinthians, 1 & 2 Samuel, Ezra, Nehemiah, Joel, Amos and Obadiah, Psalms, Zechariah, Deuteronomy, letter written to support the application for asylum of a family involved for many years helping translate the Bible into the Chechen, photos)

Gagauz (Meetings with the Gagauz team regarding Luke chapters 1-7 and later chapters 8-24, Mark 3 & 7, Matthew 11, John 5, 12, 21, Acts 17-19, Ephesian, 1 & 2 Peter, Romans 9-11, Corinthians 8-11, 2 Corinthians 10-13, Titus, Hebrews 1-8, John, Jude, and Revelation 1-3, 20-22)
Kalmyk (Meetings regarding checking various chapters. Report from the Keston Newsletter and photos of David Clark with some of the translation teams.)

Khakas (Meetings with the Khakas group regarding Matthew, Mark, Luke, John, Acts, Ephesians, 1-2 Thessalonians, 1-2 Timothy, Titus, Philippians, Revelation, Booklet of painting reproductions published by Vera Shugraeva in memory of her only son who was a gifted artist, photos of some of the translators)
Kyrgyz (Meetings with translation team and discussion of Galatians, Philippians, Matthew, Mark, 1 & 2 Peter, Jude, 1 & 2 Thessalonians, 1 & 2 Timothy, Titus, James, Colossians, and photos)
Lezgin (Meetings with the Lezgin Children’s Bible translators and checking teams for Matthew, Mark, John)

Tuvin (Meetings with the Tuvin group regarding John, Matthew, Revelation, Ephesians, Colossians, 1 & 2 Thessalonians, 1 & 2 Timothy, James, 1 & 2 Peter, Jude, 1 & 2 Corinthians, Mark, Romans, Galatians, Hebrews, Acts, and Luke; discussion about the variety of meanings of words in John and Philippians, completed checking Revelation, Philemon, Titus and Matthew, work on checking Ephesians, Colossians, 1 & 2 Thessalonians, 1 & 2 Timothy, James, 1 & 2 Peter and Jude, Romans, Galatians, Hebrews, and completion of 1 & 2 Corinthians and the revision of Mark, discussion of gaps in Luke and Acts, follow up on Galatians, Romans, and Hebrews. Note: Tuvin New Testament released May 17, 2002)
Ukrainian (Translation seminar, work on Ukrainian translation, meeting with Ukrainian translators)

Yakut (Meeting with Yakut group on Luke and John, Acts, Philippians, Titus, Matthew, 1 & 2 Thessalonians, Mark, Romans, Colossians, Revelation, 1 & 2 Corinthians, Hebrews, Psalms, Proverbs, article on Yakutia, and photos)
